intro: Isoloma sciadocalyx, commonly known as the dark-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Isoloma sciadocalyx is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
